meanings.definition: To expose excessively to light or radiation.
meanings.sent1: The photographer accidentally overexposed the film, ruining the pictures.
meanings.sent2: She always makes sure not to overexpose her skin to the sun to avoid sunburn.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight kept overexposing the room, making it hard to see anything clearly.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project was like overexposing a photograph, too intense and blinding.
meanings.sent5: The bright light overexposing the room made it feel like a sauna.

meanings.definition: To reveal too much information or details.
meanings.sent1: The spy was careful not to overexpose his cover story to avoid suspicion.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to overexpose her emotions, so she kept her feelings to herself.
meanings.sent3: The comedian accidentally overexposed his punchline, ruining the joke.
meanings.sent4: Her gossiping tendencies often led her to overexpose secrets she promised to keep.
meanings.sent5: The documentary overexposed the scandal, revealing every detail to the public.

meanings.definition: To make something appear too bright or washed out in a photograph.
meanings.sent1: The camera settings were off, causing it to overexpose the image.
meanings.sent2: He learned to adjust the exposure to avoid overexposing his photos.
meanings.sent3: The bright sunlight overexposed the landscape, making it look surreal.
meanings.sent4: The artist intentionally overexposed the painting to create a dreamy effect.
meanings.sent5: The flash overexposed the portrait, making the subject look ghostly.
